content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

You can create the `add_yearmonth` function using the ` Dates.year`, `Dates.month`, and `parse` functions. Here's the implementation:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(dt -> parse(Int, "$(Dates.year(dt))$(Dates.month(dt))")) dt in eachrow(df[:, :dt]]) end;
    return df
end
```

Now you can use the `add_yearmonth` function on your DataFrame with a column named `dt`. The new column `ym` will contain the concatenated year and month as an integer.
